header.note:
This TMX file is the master repository for the English labels used in the Twetailer application. The content is edited by the developers who generate the unique identifiers, the notes for the translators, the label/message to be displayed, and custom tags used by the build system.
This is the unique repository containing: - Information used by the browser-part of the application (dojo tech stack), - Information used by the webtier-part of the application (Java tech stack), - Information used by the layout system (Java tech stack in 7.1-can be pushed dojo-side later).
This TMX is submitted to the translation department and this entity returns many others TMX files, as many as languages required for the product.
Labels and messages defined in this TMX files and its localized versions are published at build time: - As properties files to be handled by the PropertiesResourceBundle class, - As JavaScript files defining simple maps. The target type is chosen thanks to the custom property:
Note to developers: 1) When the usage of one label occurs many time, don't hesitate to define many entries if you think that the context is different. 2) If the usage of the custom tags is important for the build process, giving information to the translators via the tag is also very important for the overall quality of the product. Don't hesitate to link entries if the labels/messages are related. Don't hesitate to give samples to illustrate your comments. 3) Be sure to generate unique identifiers. Be consistent the unique identifier format. 4) All text inserted in the tag is rendered as is. Take care of the return-to-line and spacing.
IMPORTANT NOTES: 1) Everything rendered between the tags and are rendered. So be careful to NOT insert return-to-line or extra spaces. 2) Forbidden characters are : ampersand, quotes, double-quotes, less-than. and greater-than signs Their unicode value MUST be used in place: - ampersand: \u0026 - double quotes: \u0022 - less than: \u003c - greater than: \u003e - non break space: \u00a0 Note that using th single quote is safe. 3) All messages being displayed in a Web browser, it's possible to use HTML sequences, but they MUST be escaped correctly: "" should become: "\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e". Other HTML codes (like —) are safe as the corresponding UTF-8 sequence.

tu.note: IMPORTANT: Native transcription of the language (e.g. Dansk, Deutsch, English). IMPORTANT: "English" should not be just translated! IMPORTANT: If the rest of the xml:lang attribute is left with the value "en", it's crucial to update the one of this entry with the correct value (e.g. fr, it, zh_CN, etc.).

For the Twitter adapter, message sent to non followers. {0} is the sender screen name.

tuv.seg: @{0} To protect your privacy, Follow Twetailer and then send your request via Direct Messages - like d twetailer ...

tu.note: For the Twitter adapter, confirmation of a demand creation, ready for publication. {0}: dynamically generated demand reference

tuv.seg: Listing your request for reference:{0}... You can send "!help" for more options afterwards.

tu.note: For the Twitter adapter, inform that no result can be displayed for the !list command.
For the Twitter adapter, inform that no result can be displayed for the !list command with the given reference. {0}: repetition of the reference passed as an argument to the !list command
For the Twitter adapter, introduce the series of tweets to be sent in response to a !list command. {0}: number of messages to be sent

tuv.seg: This message is followed by {0} tweet(s) - one per active demand...

tu.note: Inform the consumer the demand should have at least one tag. {0} is the demand reference.

tuv.seg: Your demand reference:{0} should have at least one tag.

tu.note: Inform the consumer the expiration date should be in the future. {0} is the demand reference.

tuv.seg: Your demand reference:{0} should have its expiration date in the future.

tu.note: Inform the consumer the range is too small. {0} is the demand reference. {1} is the too small distance.

tuv.seg: The range ({1} km) for the demand reference:{0} is too small. It should be greater than 5 km.

tu.note: Inform the consumer the range is too small. {0} is the demand reference. {1} is the too small distance.

tuv.seg: The range ({1} mi) for the demand reference:{0} is too small. It should be greater than 3 miles.

tu.note: Inform the consumer the quantity cannot be 0. {0} is the demand reference.

tuv.seg: Your demand reference:{0} should concern at least one item.

tu.note: Inform the consumer that the locale information is missing. {0} is the demand reference.

tuv.seg: Please update the Demand reference:{0} with your locale(postal/zip code and country) - like \u0022 ref:{0} locale:12345 us \u0022

tu.note: Inform the consumer that the locale information is invalid. {0} is the demand reference, {1} is the given postal code, and {2} is the country code.

tuv.seg: The locale \u0022{1} {2}\u0022 given demand reference:{0} cannot be resolved. Please provide a valid locale(postal/zip code and country) - like \u0022 ref:{0} locale:12345 us \u0022

tu.note: Inform the consumer that the information for the locale cannot be retrieved.

tuv.seg: The locale information for demand reference:{0} cannot be retrieved. Please provide them another time (postal/zip code and country).

tu.note: Inform a retailer about a new demand. {0} is the reference of the demand. {1} is the demand tags separated by a comma. {2} is the expiration date in ISO format.

tuv.seg: Can you serve demand reference:{0} with the tags: {1}? The expiration date is: {2}.

tu.note: Inform twetailer there's a proposition. {0} is the reference of the demand. {1} is the demand tags. {2} is the store key
